p: Some of the halophytic grasses with reports of their biological activities were already recognized for their use in traditional medicine. For instance, D. bipinnata has been used in Indian traditional medicine for the treatment of various disorders such as asthma, kidney stone, diarrhea and wound healing [ 157, 158]. Similarly, I. cylindrica has been used for renal disorders [ 159] while S. spontaneum has been used for the treatment of mental illnesses as well as gastrointestinal disorders [ 160].
